metadata.titel_preek: Lent and Holy Week: Ash Wednesday & First Sunday in Lent

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in the human condition of universal sin and self-deception to justify the ungodly through the substitutionary death of Christ.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically in the person of Jesus Christ)
tekstueel_bewijs: God has shown us a great thing.
There is Another who has taken the sentence upon himself.
He has wrought the salvation of his enemies.

object.identificatie: Salvation, justification, and the 'remission and forgiveness' of the sinner.
tekstueel_bewijs: the salvation of each and every one of us

zender.identificatie: The Holy God / The Author of all goodness
tekstueel_bewijs: the reality of God, the power of God, the holiness of God
the salvation of each and every one of us
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly placed in the position of the Receiver/Beneficiary who is currently an Opponent.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus, the Son of God, has voluntarily taken our place.
bearing in his own body the storm of the wrath of God
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject (Sender) and Helper (Christ).
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power requested in prayer ('renew a right spirit').

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a Cosmic Power and Human Self-Deception/Pride.
tekstueel_bewijs: the storm of the wrath of God against sin
the line separating good and evil passes... through every human heart
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is not merely a mistake but a condition that 'dominates us' and requires a divine death to nullify.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of repentance and 'insight' into one's own condition.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Psalmist
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon insists that the knowledge of grace (Program 1) precedes and enables the confession of sin (Program 2).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has shown us a great thing.
God made him to be sin.
He has wrought the salvation of his enemies.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We do not need to surround ourselves with defenses.

voorbeelden: The person who confesses sin in this free way...
The knowledge of grace has preceded the confession.
God is truly able to do away with sin.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'ability' (Pouvoir) to save the 'unable' sinner. It shifts the burden from the hearer's 'having to' to God's 'being able'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the false security of ~S1 (pretense) to the crushing reality of S2 (judgment), then reveals that Christ has occupied S2 so the hearer can move to S1 via ~S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Substitutionary Atonement: Christ takes the 'sentence' (S2) to grant 'righteousness' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; sin is described as a 'storm of wrath' and 'cosmic' in scope.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It systematically deconstructs human agency in salvation and positions God as the sole initiator and finisher of the work.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Our two greatest presidents... both called the nation to repentance.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He has wrought the salvation of his enemies.
The knowledge of grace has preceded the confession of sin.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The psalmist is used not as a moral hero to emulate, but as a 'witness' to the human condition and God's mercy.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already treats the Psalmist theocentrically.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'exhausting charade' of self-justification.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; the hearer is the 'ungodly' for whom Christ died.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative programs are perfectly ordered: God's action (Soteriology) creates the possibility for human insight (Ethics/Repentance).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus, the Son of God, has voluntarily taken our place.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the one who 'renews a right spirit' within the incompetent subject.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an 'onslaught' and a 'storm' that humans cannot manage.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: God (in Christ's finished work on the cross).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative. The hearer is never the hero, only the beneficiary.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain this; it is the essence of a grace-oriented sermon.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric preaching. It avoids the trap of making repentance a 'work' by grounding it in the prior reality of God's grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the use of Tolkien/Solzhenitsyn as 'illustrations', Greimasian analysis shows they serve to define the 'Opponent' as a universal, inescapable power.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains what Psalm 51 meant; this analysis shows how the sermon functions as a 'delivery system' for the act of justification.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Subject' of the verb 'repent' is actually moved by the 'Sender' (God), making even repentance a gift rather than a human competence.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's grammar of grace almost perfectly.
